page.title: 01Anstruther - Introduction
page.content: Our block lies to the SE of St Andrews on the north coast of the River Forth in a part called the "East Neuk" or east corner of Fife. The block divides naturally into 4 bands - the sea, the foreshore, the towns and the farmland. The towns are Anstruther, Cellardyke and the small village of Kilrenny. The area has been described as delightful, charismatic, picturesque and unspoilt and is very popular with tourists. Many inhabitants of our area choose to stay in these surroundings and travel to work by car or bus to towns such as Dundee, Glenrothes, Kirkcaldy, Leven and St Andrews. Many men now work away from home in the oil related industries. We enjoy staying in this area. There are always plenty of things to do.
